title: Hearer of Prayer
first:
1.
It’s hard at first to express what’s deep within.
Turning my thoughts into words, where do I begin?
O Jehovah, I will never stop making the time to linger on in prayer.
I won’t bottle up all of these things I really want to share.
(CHORUS)
I’ll pour out my heart like water
To you, my heavenly Father.
I’ll pour out my heart like water
So that our bond will grow stronger.
When I say what’s on my mind,
I can leave it all behind because it’s safe in your hands.
You grant me peace beyond compare.
You’re the Hearer of prayer.
second:
2.
I am in awe of the love you show to me,
To think that you listen and care ev’ry time I speak!
So, Jehovah, I will never stop praying to you; this will always be my lifeline.
If I start to slip, I’ll call to you and you’ll help me at the right time.
(CHORUS)
I’ll pour out my heart like water
To you, my heavenly Father.
I’ll pour out my heart like water
So that our bond will grow stronger.
When I say what’s on my mind,
I can leave it all behind because it’s safe in your hands.
You grant me peace beyond compare.
You’re the Hearer of prayer.
third:
(BRIDGE)
And there is no wall, no ceiling—there’s nothing—that stops you from list’ning
To your loyal ones who follow your Son.
Their prayers you are answering.
You grant peace beyond compare.
(CHORUS)
I’ll pour out my heart like water
To you, my heavenly Father.
I’ll pour out my heart like water
So that our bond will grow stronger.
When I say what’s on my mind,
I can leave it all behind because it’s safe in your hands.
You grant me peace beyond compare.
You’re the Hearer of prayer.
(ENDING)
You’re the Hearer of prayer.
You’re the Hearer of prayer.
You’re the Hearer of prayer.
You’re the Hearer of prayer.

title: A Higher Kind of Love
first:
1.
There was something that was said that really did stick with me,
That no matter where I am from, I can be your family.
We are a worldwide household under the law of love
In the comfort of the caring arms of Jehovah God above.
No sweeter place could I ever find myself in
Than here with you all now. Oh, I’m singing:
(CHORUS)
“You are my sister; you are my brother;
You are my father; you are my mother.
And it is not by blood.
It’s a higher kind of love.
You are my sister; you are my brother;
You are my fam’ly, like no other.
And it is not by blood, no.
It’s a higher kind of love,
A higher kind of love.”
second:
2.
It’s as certain as the sunrise. It’s a written guarantee.
It’s the promise of God’s own Son that you will have a family.
Coming from all walks of life, praises to God we sing.
It doesn’t matter where we are from. It’s doing His will; that’s the key.
We have a hundredfold now, along with tribulations,
So we help each other out. Oh, I’m singing:
(CHORUS)
“You are my sister; you are my brother;
You are my father; you are my mother.
And it is not by blood, no.
It’s a higher kind of love.
You are my sister; you are my brother;
You are my fam’ly, like no other.
And it is not by blood, no.
It’s a higher kind of love,
A higher kind of love,
A higher kind of love.”
third:
(BRIDGE)
Any one of us could stumble and fall in our life,
But then our brother comes along at just the right time.
There was something that was said that I have really seen,
That no matter where I am from, I can be your family, yeah!
Oh, I can be, I can be, I can be your family, yeah!
(CHORUS)
You are my sister; you are my brother;
You are my father; you are my mother.
And it is not by blood.
It’s a higher kind of love.
You are my sister; you are my brother;
You are my fam’ly, like no other.
And it is not by blood, no.
It’s a higher kind of love.

title: My Spiritual Need
first:
1.
There is a need in each heart
God put within from the start:
Yearning to know what life is for,
Thirsting for something more.
Though some may search in despair,
God’s Word has always been there—
Words that bring hope, joy that is real,
Happiness I can feel.
(CHORUS)
I’ll praise Jehovah each day,
Walk in his light, follow his way.
I’ll give Jehovah my life,
Trusting that he’ll provide.
I will always feed
My spiritual need.
second:
2.
I know I need to make time
Thinking on truths that I find,
Feeding my faith, helping me see
How to be truly free.
Though some may choose to ignore,
I’ll pray they open the door.
Then they can feel true peace of mind,
Happiness just like mine.
(CHORUS)
I’ll praise Jehovah each day,
Walk in his light, follow his way.
I’ll give Jehovah my life,
Trusting that he’ll provide.
I will always feed
My spiritual need.
I’ll praise Jehovah each day,
Walk in his light, follow his way.
I’ll give Jehovah my life,
Trusting that he’ll provide.
I will always feed
My spiritual need.
I’ll praise Jehovah each day,
Walk in his light, follow his way.
I’ll give Jehovah my life,
Trusting that he’ll provide.
I will always feed
My spiritual need.

title: Tell Them You Love Them
first:
1.
A beautiful rose needs rain to grow,
And your words can be like gentle rain.
Your loved ones right there need to know that you care,
And they’ll bloom and thrive once again.
(CHORUS)
Tell them you love them; they need to know.
Tell them you love them; help them to grow.
Your love will shine through in the things that you do,
But you should still tell them; tell them you love them.
second:
2.
Though love’s in our heart, we can still find it hard
To express what we’re feeling inside.
The love that we feel we need to reveal
To the dear ones who light up our lives.
(CHORUS)
Tell them you love them; they need to know.
Tell them you love them; help them to grow.
Your love will shine through in the things that you do,
But you should still tell them; tell them you love them.
Tell them you love them; they need to know.
Tell them you love them; help them to grow.
Your love will shine through in the things that you do,
But you should still tell them; tell them you love them.
third:
(BRIDGE)
When Jesus (he) heard a voice from above,
His Father declaring that he was beloved,
Though he already knew, how those words must have felt
And lifted him up!
(CHORUS)
Tell them you love them; they need to know.
Tell them you love them; help them to grow.
Your love will shine through in the things that you do,
But you should still tell them you’ve been thinking of them.
Tell them you love them; they need to know.
Tell them you love them; help them to grow.
Your love will shine through in the things that you do,
But you should still tell them; tell them you love them.

title: We See You, Sister
first:
1.
I’d like to take this time just to let you know
I am inspired by the faithfulness you’ve always shown.
With pen and paper, I put down these words
To help you understand that we all can see your worth.
(PRE-CHORUS)
Whenever you find that you’re hard on yourself,
I hope these words help.
(CHORUS)
We see you, sister,
Always a smile on your face.
You keep on going
Though you may doubt your precious place.
If you could only see yourself through our eyes,
Then you would know how we see you.
We see you, sister.
second:
2.
You’re always looking out to help behind the scenes
Without the hope of praise for all you do for those in need.
The gifts you give in secret have become known.
You’ve lifted others up with so much love as they have grown.
(PRE-CHORUS)
You think it’s not much, but there are so many times
You have touched our lives.
(CHORUS)
We see you, sister,
Always a smile on your face.
You keep on going
Though you may doubt your precious place.
If you could only see yourself through our eyes,
Then you would know how we see you.
We see you, sister.
third:
(BRIDGE)
Jehovah’s greater than your heart.
He sees the beautiful gem that you are
As you work hard to do your part.
(CHORUS)
We see you, sister,
Always a smile on your face.
You keep on going
Though you may doubt your precious place.
If you could only see yourself through our eyes,
Then you would know how we see you.
We see you, sister.
(ENDING)
Don’t lose that smile on your face.
Here you have found your precious place.
We see you, sister.
We see you, we see you, sister.
We see you, sister.

title: The Road to Life
first:
1.
When you’re young, it’s hard to find your way—
Decisions every day:
Who to be, what to love, where to put your trust.
It’s not easy to find your place.
(PRE-CHORUS)
But I know how I feel,
That Jehovah is real.
He knows what I need.
I will succeed if I follow his lead.
(CHORUS)
With his Word, I know the way to go.
Jehovah’s with me all the way, I know.
So I will keep myself on this road to life.
second:
2.
There are paths my heart wants me to choose;
Jehovah sees that too.
So I pray ev’ry day to keep on the way,
And he helps me to see what is true.
(PRE-CHORUS)
And with the brotherhood,
I always feel so good.
’Cause with the love I’m shown,
I can be sure that I’m never alone.
(CHORUS)
With his Word, I know the way to go.
Jehovah’s with me all the way, I know.
So I will keep myself on this road to life.
third:
(BRIDGE)
I can’t look back on where I could have been.
I’ll keep looking forward to a life that never ends.
(CHORUS)
With his Word, I know the way to go.
Jehovah’s with me all the way, I know.
So I will keep myself on this road to life,
On the road to life.

title: Every Minute
first:
1.
Our life is like a mist that appears;
In a moment of time, it’s gone.
And our love is like the warm summer sun;
Let it shine on the ones we love while there’s time.
(CHORUS)
I could take it all for granted, let time just slip away,
And forget to love the ones I love right now.
I could put off till tomorrow what I can do today,
But I never want regrets to bring me down.
So I’m counting ev’ry minute and making ev’ry minute count.
second:
2.
When I see so much beauty around,
All the love that Jehovah has shown,
Then I know that I want to give to him
Ev’ry hour, ev’ry minute of life that I own.
(CHORUS)
I could take it all for granted, let time just slip away,
And forget to show my love for him right now.
I could put off till tomorrow what I can do today,
But I never want regrets to bring me down.
So I’m counting ev’ry minute and making ev’ry minute count.
third:
(BRIDGE)
Right ahead is a beautiful new world
That Jehovah wants to share.
And our time is a gift that we can give.
So until that day is here,
(CHORUS)
I won’t take it all for granted or let time slip away
Or forget to love the ones I love right now.
I won’t put off till tomorrow all that I can do today,
’Cause I never want regrets to bring me down.
That’s why I’m counting ev’ry minute and making ev’ry minute count.

title: It’s Filled With Love
first:
1.
Like a letter from a loved one that I’m reading ev’ry day,
As I turn the precious pages, so many thoughts that come my way⁠—
And ev’ry day that passes gives me reason to be sure
That the things that I am reading will comfort me some more.
(CHORUS)
Like the dew there in the morning,
Like the warmth that’s from the sun,
Like the moonlight on the water—
It’s there for ev’ryone.
Like a pillow is for comfort,
So your words can comfort me.
And as I meditate on this,
It’s easy just to see
It’s filled with love—
Jehovah’s love.
second:
2.
It reminds me not to worry⁠—that a trial will never last⁠—gives me hope for the future, helps me learn from the past.
Your promise draws me close to you as you draw close to me.
And once again I’m thankful for the gifts that I can see.
(CHORUS)
Like the dew there in the morning,
Like the warmth that’s from the sun,
Like the moonlight on the water—
It’s there for ev’ryone.
Like a pillow is for comfort,
So your words can comfort me.
And as I meditate on this,
It’s easy just to see
It’s filled with love—
Jehovah’s love.
third:
(BRIDGE)
Like a tree growing by a stream, I’m stronger ev’ry day,
Building up the faith that I need.
It makes me want to share the love that’s found right there
And just how much your Word means to me.
forth:
3.
Like a letter from a loved one that I’m reading ev’ry day,
As I turn the precious pages, so many thoughts that come my way⁠—
And ev’ry day that passes gives me reason to be sure
That the things that I am reading will comfort me some more.
(CHORUS)
Like the dew there in the morning,
Like the warmth that’s from the sun,
Like the moonlight on the water—
It’s there for ev’ryone.
Like a pillow is for comfort,
So your words can comfort me.
And as I meditate on this,
It’s easy just to see
It’s filled with love—
Jehovah’s love.

title: To Do Your Will Is My Delight (2025 Convention Song)
first:
1.
As your Son rose up from the Jordan
And your precious words filled his heart,
He was deeply moved by your purpose,
And he longed to play his part.
He refused to yield to temptation.
He was zealous for your name.
He gave ev’rything he could give you,
And I long to do the same.
(CHORUS)
To do your will is my delight.
I give you all my strength and might.
This joy I feel; this joy is real.
I will walk on in your light.
To do your will is my delight.
I have a hope so clear and bright.
Your love I feel; your love is real.
I will praise you day and night.
It’s my delight.
second:
2.
As I’ve come to know you, Jehovah,
I’ve found happiness deep inside.
I will gladly speak as your witness,
And your truth I will not hide.
Serving side by side with my brothers,
There’s no better way to live.
I will bear your name, oh, so proudly.
I’ll give all that I can give.
(CHORUS)
To do your will is my delight.
I give you all my strength and might.
This joy I feel; this joy is real.
I will walk on in your light.
To do your will is my delight.
I have a hope so clear and bright.
Your love I feel; your love is real.
I will praise you day and night.
It’s my delight.
Your will is my delight.

title: It Won’t Be Long
first:
1.
Time keeps on ticking; the years seem to fly.
I’m not getting younger; from pain, I can’t hide.
But I know it won’t be long.
I have lost loved ones at times in my life,
And living without them has been a hard fight.
But I know it won’t be long.
(CHORUS)
And I will wake up tomorrow, and life will be new.
The Kingdom has come, and forever its rule over us will bring peace.
It won’t be long.
Friends and loved ones we’re welcoming back.
Pain and sorrow is all in the past.
Yes, I know Jehovah’s will will be done in all the earth.
It won’t be long.
second:
2.
When I look at this world and the days we’re in,
The time is reduced. It is clear, my friend.
Yes, I know it won’t be long.
So I try my best to do what is right,
To make Jehovah the purpose in my life,
’Cause I know it won’t be long.
(CHORUS)
And I will wake up tomorrow, and life will be new.
The Kingdom has come, and forever its rule over us will bring peace.
It won’t be long.
Friends and loved ones we’re welcoming back.
Pain and sorrow is all in the past.
Yes, I know Jehovah’s will will be done in all the earth.
It won’t be long.
third:
(BRIDGE)
Even if I don’t get to see this old world pass away,
Safe I know I will be in Jehovah’s memory.
(CHORUS)
And I will wake up tomorrow, and life will be new.
The Kingdom has come, and forever its rule over us will bring peace.
It won’t be long.
Friends and loved ones will welcome me back.
Pain and sorrow is all in the past.
Yes, I know Jehovah’s will will be done in all the earth.
And we’ll see Paradise.
It won’t be long.

title: I Am in Your Hands
first:
1.
Jehovah, my God, your eyes can see
An imperfect heart inside of me.
Still, I try to serve you loyally.
When my words get away without restraint
Or things that I do don’t bring you praise,
I beg you, “Please keep working with me.”
(PRE-CHORUS)
I look to you, my Father.
I am the clay; you are my Potter,
(CHORUS)
Shaping me into something new,
Something that brings praise to you,
Someone who brings a smile to your face.
Mold me with your loving care.
Help me to draw close in prayer.
My Father, here I am!
I am in your hands.
I am in your hands.
second:
2.
I am making the time to read your Word
And calling to mind the things I’ve heard.
How I love the way you refine me!
Please put within me a humble heart
That helps me each day to make a new start.
I won’t let my mistakes define me.
(PRE-CHORUS)
I look to you, my Father.
I am the clay; you are my Potter,
(CHORUS)
Shaping me into something new,
Something that brings praise to you,
Someone who brings a smile to your face.
Mold me with your loving care.
Help me to draw close in prayer.
My Father, here I am!
I am in your hands.
I am in your hands.
(OUTRO)
Help me be like soft clay.
Work with me ev’ry day.
My Father, here I am.
I am in your hands.
I am in your hands.

title: Living Peacefully in a Peaceless World
first:
1.
When I drive my car or I take a train, there’s an angry world out there.
Each day arrives, and so many lives have heavy loads to bear.
Then Jehovah’s words come back to me, ‘Be patient, calm, and kind,
And no matter where, say a silent prayer for a peaceful state of mind.’
(CHORUS)
Living peacefully in a peaceless world is easier said than done.
But if you can do it now, just imagine how it’ll feel when the new world comes!
second:
2.
Then I get to work, and the day seems good, but I’m feeling things might change.
Without a doubt, the storm breaks out, but I’m keeping out of range.
I recall the words that I read before: ‘Life’s more than what you see’—
That ‘Behind the scorn may be a heart that’s torn and in need of sympathy.’
(CHORUS)
Living peacefully in a peaceless world is easier said than done.
But if you can do it now, just imagine how it’ll feel when the new world comes!
third:
(BRIDGE)
It’s never an easy ride
When you’re going against the tide.
In a world that’s lost and torn apart,
‘The God of peace will guard your heart.’
forth:
3.
Then the weekend comes, and we’re taking turns sharing good news door to door,
But something someone heard brings an angry word, and we hear the lion roar.
With the Bible’s words speaking loud and clear, we prepare to ‘take our leave.’
There’s “no wood” about, so “the fire goes out,” and we go our way in peace.
(CHORUS)
Living peacefully in a peaceless world is easier said than done.
But if you can do it now, just imagine how it’ll feel when the new world comes!
(CHORUS)
Living peacefully in a peaceless world is easier said than done.
But if you can do it now, just imagine how it’ll feel when the new world comes!

title: Give Jehovah Glory
first:
1.
Who is like you, O Jehovah,
High on your heavenly throne?
How could I ever repay you
For all of the love you have shown?
When I look up to the heavens,
Power and glory I see.
Who then am I, O Jehovah,
That you would show favor to me?
(CHORUS)
Jehovah God, please hear the song I sing.
It’s a song of praise to you.
You are my God and the Eternal King,
So I give you what is due;
All the glory goes to you.
second:
2.
My life is yours, O Jehovah.
May all I do bring you praise.
Gladly I’ll speak of your goodness
And tell of your glorious ways.
Serving you, Great God, Jehovah,
Fills me with honor and pride.
You are my strength and my glory.
Forever may you be my Guide.
(CHORUS)
Jehovah God, please hear the song I sing.
It’s a song of praise to you.
You are my God and the Eternal King,
So I give you what is due;
All the glory goes to you.
third:
3.
Oceans and valleys below me,
Sun, moon, and stars up above
Fill me with joy and with wonder
And show me your unending love.
Majesty, wisdom, and beauty:
These are the things that I see.
How could I not give you glory
For making it all come to be?
(CHORUS)
Jehovah God, please hear the song I sing.
It’s a song of praise to you.
You are my God and the Eternal King,
So I give you what is due;
All the glory goes to you.

title: The Power Beyond My Own
first:
1.
Jehovah God, a weight I bear
Of anxious thoughts, of all of life’s cares.
I approach your throne so sure that you
Will hold my hand
And help me get through.
(PRE-CHORUS)
I do pray
To have your spirit ev’ry day.
(CHORUS)
With a lift from you,
I can fly up high above the world below.
Like an eagle with its wings outstretched,
I soar on the power beyond my own,
The power beyond my own.
second:
2.
The strength I’ve gained from you, my God,
Helps me, in turn, care for downhearted ones.
And when they know that you are there,
They feel your love and tender care.
(PRE-CHORUS)
I do pray
To have your spirit ev’ry day.
(CHORUS)
With a lift from you,
I can fly up high above the world below.
Like an eagle with its wings outstretched,
I soar on the power beyond my own,
The power beyond my own.
(CHORUS)
With a lift from you,
I can fly up high above the world below.
Like an eagle with its wings outstretched,
I soar on the power beyond my own,
The power beyond my own,
The power beyond my own,
The power beyond my own.

title: Let’s Keep It Simple
first:
1.
All the shiny things that we see
Promise us pleasure and security.
But if we want it all, there’s a cost—
We could be slaves to what we’ve bought.
(CHORUS)
Let’s keep it simple.
Jehovah knows what we need.
Let’s keep it simple and be happy.
Let’s keep it simple,
And you and I will be free.
Let’s keep it simple and be happy.
second:
2.
We have roofs over our heads,
Food to eat, and nice, warm beds.
If we are satisfied with simple things,
We’ll feel the joy and peace it brings.
(CHORUS)
Let’s keep it simple.
Jehovah knows what we need.
Let’s keep it simple and be happy.
Let’s keep it simple,
And you and I will be free.
Let’s keep it simple and be happy.
third:
(BRIDGE)
God will bless us if we try.
He will never let us down.
He is loving, just, and wise.
He will be our solid ground.
On him we can rely.
forth:
3.
How good it feels to live the simple life!
Our hearts are happy, and our loads are light.
With all this weight taken off our chests,
We’re free to give our God our best.
(CHORUS)
Let’s keep it simple.
Jehovah knows what we need.
Let’s keep it simple and be happy.
Let’s keep it simple,
And you and I will be free.
Let’s keep it simple.
(CHORUS)
Let’s keep it simple.
Jehovah knows what we need.
Let’s keep it simple and be happy.
Let’s keep it simple,
And you and I will be free.
Let’s keep it simple and be happy.

title: Pause and Reset
first:
1.
Sitting around the fire beneath a million stars,
Letting go of the cares of the day, we share the reflections of our heart.
It’s so nice to make the time to think of all the good.
Daily gifts from above—how God shows us his love—fill us with gratitude.
(CHORUS)
We’re just taking a moment to change our focus,
Slowing down to look up and reflect
On the simple things, the joy it brings to slow down,
To take a deep breath,
Pause, and reset.
second:
2.
As the moon shines through the forest in the stillness of the night,
Our spirits are lifted by ev’ry good gift that comes from our Father up high.
As we see the bigger picture beyond the trials we face,
You and I can endure as our hearts are assured of Jehovah’s warm embrace.
(CHORUS)
We’re just taking a moment to change our focus,
Slowing down to look up and reflect
On the simple things, the joy it brings to slow down,
To take a deep breath,
Pause, and reset.
Pause and reset;
Pause and reset.
(CHORUS)
We’re just taking a moment to change our focus,
Slowing down to look up and reflect
On the simple things, the joy it brings to slow down,
To take a deep breath,
Pause, and reset.
(ENDING)
Savor the moment; change our focus.
So take a deep breath.
Savor the moment; change our focus.
Slow down, take a deep breath,
Pause, and reset.

title: “The Real Life”
first:
1.
I open my eyes to the bluest skies that I’ve ever seen before.
There’s nothing to fear, and ev’ryone is here.
Come on out; let’s go explore.
Let’s climb the highest mountaintop and take it all in.
Every single gift we have Jehovah’s given.
(PRE-CHORUS)
But for now, we will wait for that day when
(CHORUS)
We will raise our heads and lift our voices when this old world’s behind.
When Jehovah opens up his hands, imagine what we’ll find
In the real life!
second:
2.
Hands in the dirt, building a whole new earth—we’ve been given a new start.
Joy in the air, people laughing ev’rywhere—and the sound fills up my heart.
No one will ever make you cry—except the good kind.
This Paradise lights up your smile, and it shines; it shines.
(CHORUS)
And we will raise our heads and lift our voices when this old world’s behind.
When Jehovah opens up his hands, imagine what we’ll find
In the real life!
third:
(BRIDGE)
But for now, I’ll keep this picture safe and sound in my mind.
Soon will come the day that we’ve been waiting for all our lives
(CHORUS)
When we will raise our heads and lift our voices when this old world’s behind.

We will find—we will find
The real life.
We will find—we will find
The real life.
We will find—we will find

Joy for all mankind—

second:

Joy for all mankind—
Praise Jah for his light!
Good news, this good news—
Preach with all your might.

Good news, this good news—

title: ‘Peace Becomes Just Like a River’
first:
1.
It’s hard to face this life with all we see,
To not focus on the uncertainty.
Anxious thoughts at times we all may feel,
But when we pray, his promise is real.
(CHORUS)

Peace like a cool, gentle rain—
The hope to carry on,
The power to stand strong and know we’re not on our own.
And his peace will flow forever, yes, peace like a river.
second:
2.
So pour out your heart to him in prayer.
Jehovah’s listening; he’s always there
To comfort us and guard our heart and mind.
Unfailing love from him we find.
(CHORUS)
He gives us peace like a river—
Peace like a cool, gentle rain—
The hope to carry on,
The power to stand strong and know we’re not on our own.
And his peace will flow forever, yes, peace like a river.
(CHORUS)
He gives us peace like a river—
Peace like a cool, gentle rain—
The hope to carry on,
The power to stand strong and know we’re not on our own.

title: Feed My Faith
first:
1.
‘Is it true that this is the path I should choose?’ I asked myself.
I had a mind full of questions and, not to mention,
This world didn’t help.
But I made the time to prove I really have the truth.
When I have to deal with what distorts my view,
This is what I do:
(CHORUS)
I feed my faith and starve my doubts.
I beg Jehovah, “Help me out
To feed my faith and starve my doubts.”
And he answers me by giving me what I need
To feed my faith,
To feed my faith,
To feed my faith.
second:
2.
I can see that the Devil tries to blur the lines of right and wrong.
But I won’t be complacent, thinking I can face this
On my own and be strong.
So I look away from what misleads; I’m not deceived.
Jehovah’s words have proven trustworthy.
My hope is guaranteed!
(CHORUS)
I feed my faith and starve my doubts.
I beg Jehovah, “Help me out
To feed my faith and starve my doubts.”
And he answers me by giving me what I need
To feed my faith,
To feed my faith,
To feed my faith.
third:
(BRIDGE)
It could be a well-known verse, meditation,
The words of a song or a conversation
That answers my silent prayers all through the day
To feed my faith.
(CHORUS)
I feed my faith and starve my doubts.
I beg Jehovah, “Help me out
To feed my faith and starve my doubts.”
He always answers me by giving me just what I need
To feed my faith,
To feed my faith,
To feed my faith,
To feed my faith,
To feed my faith,
To feed my faith.

title: Home
first:
1.
I can feel lost sometimes,
Like I’m drifting out to sea,
When troubles in my life
Take me far from Kingdom realities.
But I’m never left in the lurch.
Jehovah hears and sends out the search.
(CHORUS)
He finds me, lifts me up in his arms.
He carries me safely away from harm.
He brings me back to his fold—my home, my family.
I am never alone when I’m home.
second:
2.
There is no place like this.
It’s a shelter from the storm
Where I find peace and rest
And loving friends who bring out the very best.
So if you find you’re out on your own,
Jehovah will hear your cries to come home.
(CHORUS)
He’ll find you, lead you back with his voice,
Remind you serving him was your best choice.
He’ll bring you back to his fold—your home, your family.
You are never alone when you’re home.
third:
(BRIDGE)
How we’ll be singing:
“You made it back! Welcome home!”
It’s where you belong;
And we’re so happy to see you.
Now you’re home.
You are home.
(CHORUS)
He found you, lifted you up in his arms.
He carried you safely away from harm.
He brought you back to his fold.
You’ll never be alone
When you’re home.

title: We Can’t Hold Back
first:
1.
The signs we see are clear;
The end of this world is near.
But how will they know the way to go
Without a chance to hear?
second:
2.
The truth we cannot hide.
Our fear we must set aside.
Look to God, and pray to fan the flame,
And let it burn inside.
(CHORUS)
With this fire in our bones,
We’ll make his message known.
We know we can’t hold back.
So let’s keep it burning bright
And spread his glorious light.
We know we can’t hold back.
We can’t hold back.
third:
3.
So let’s do all we can.
Soon these words of hope will end.
When that time has come, we’ll stand as one;
God’s name we will defend.
(CHORUS)
With this fire in our bones,
We’ll make his message known.
We know we can’t hold back.
So let’s keep it burning bright
And spread his glorious light.
We know we can’t hold back.
We can’t hold back.
forth:
(BRIDGE)
So keep the fire burning; keep it burning strong.
Jehovah’s day is near; it won’t be long.
Let’s carry on.
(CHORUS)
With this fire in our bones,
We’ll make his message known.
We know we can’t hold back.
So let’s keep it burning bright
And spread his glorious light.
We know we can’t hold back.
We can’t hold back.
We can’t hold back.
We can’t hold back.

title: He Knows Us
first:
1.
When we were woven in the depths of the earth,
Before we even came into this world,
Jehovah saw right from the start
Deep down inside our beating heart.
Just stop and think what that means.
(CHORUS)
He knows you; he knows me—
What we feel, what we see,
When we try hard to give our best,
The joys we feel, and our regrets.
He knows you; he knows me—
What we need, what we plead.
When we can’t find the words to say, we’re not alone.
He knows.
second:
2.
Like a father wants his child to succeed,

He sifts through us and sees where we shine

(CHORUS)
He knows you; he knows me—
What we feel, what we see,
When we try hard to give our best,
The joys we feel, and our regrets.
He knows you; he knows me—
What we need, what we plead.
When we can’t find the words to say, we’re not alone.
He knows.
third:
(BRIDGE)

Tell him when life is hard and fear’s got a grip on our heart.
Remember, we’re okay; we don’t have to be afraid.
(CHORUS)
He knows you; he knows me—
What we feel, what we see,
When we try hard to give our best,
The joys we feel, and our regrets.
He knows you; he knows me—
What we need, what we plead.
When we can’t find the words to say, we’re not alone.
(CHORUS)
He knows you; he knows me—
What we feel, what we see,
When we try hard to give our best,
The joys we feel, and our regrets.
He knows you; he knows me—

title: “Two Small Coins”
first:
1.
Two small coins
Are all that she can give.
As she waits,
The courtyard echoes with bountiful gifts.
Lost in the crowd,
Like a single grain of sand,
Will her Father take note
Of the two small coins in her hand?
(CHORUS)
No matter how small,
Don’t wonder at all,
‘Does he notice my sacrifice?’
It’s not hard to believe
If we see how he sees—
If we see through Jehovah’s eyes—
Two small coins.
second:
2.
Would she have thought
Of all she’d given before—
Of easier times
When she had the means to give so much more?
She drops in her coins,
Unheard by others around.
But for Jehovah God,
This small gift made a thunderous sound.
(CHORUS)
No matter how small,
Don’t wonder at all,
‘Does he notice my sacrifice?’
It’s not hard to believe
If we see how he sees—
If we see through Jehovah’s eyes—
Two small coins.
third:

(CHORUS)
No matter how small,
Don’t wonder at all,
‘Does he notice my sacrifice?’
It’s not hard to believe
If we see how he sees—
If we see through Jehovah’s eyes—
Two small coins.
Do you see through Jehovah’s eyes?

title: When All Hearts Sing as One
first:

Through all these stormy seas
And empty philosophies,
Jehovah provides a hope for mankind,
A world we’re longing to see:
(CHORUS)
One faith, one God,
Peace on earth,
One mind, one voice
Throughout the universe
When all hearts sing as one.
second:
2.
Know that this hope is sure
Despite what we might endure.
Jehovah is there and lovingly shares
Peace that flows like a river,
Calming our doubts and fears,
Drying up ev’ry tear.
Forever we’ll find true peace of mind,
Knowing soon we will see:
(CHORUS)
One faith, one God,
Peace on earth,
One mind, one voice
Throughout the universe
When all hearts sing as one.
third:

Every knee will bend

(CHORUS)
One faith, one God,
Peace on earth,
One mind, one voice
Throughout the universe—
One faith, one God,
Peace on earth,
One mind, one voice
Throughout the universe

God’s will on earth is done!

title: Draw Close to Me
first:

(CHORUS)

And I’ll draw close to you.
I’ll help you see, help you see,
The good that I see in you
If you draw close to me.”
second:

(CHORUS)
He says: “Draw close to me, close to me,
And I’ll draw close to you.
I’ll help you see, help you see,
The good that I see in you
If you draw close to me.”
third:
(BRIDGE)

He saw the best in me.
And now he’s just a prayer away,
My God eternally.
(CHORUS)
He says: “Draw close to me, close to me,
And I’ll draw close to you.
I’ll help you see, help you see,
The good that I see in you

No matter how long it takes,
“It will not be late!”
second:

(CHORUS)
Father, we long to see Paradise come to be.
Give us the patience to wait.
We know your day will come, sure as the rising sun.
No matter how long it takes,
“It will not be late!”
third:

Give us the patience to wait.
We know your day will come, sure as the rising sun.

(CHORUS)

second:

(CHORUS)
So stand tall; give your all.
Jehovah’s right there with you; he won’t let you fall.
And pray ev’ry day
To climb those mountains out there standing in your way.

(CHORUS)

You can turn this around.
Get back up; stand up tall.

Just reach out; take his hand.
He’ll raise you up—make you stand.

You’ll be stronger than before

second:
2.
Another dawn is breaking,
And your heart may be aching.
But you can’t go back in time.

His Word is there to guide you,
To pick you up and show you what to do.
(CHORUS)
Get back up when you’re down.
You can turn this around.
Get back up; stand up tall.

Just reach out; take his hand.

title: Friends Again
first:

This grudge I’ve held since I was hurt,

(CHORUS)

second:
2.

third:

title: I Know Jehovah’s With Me
first:

(CHORUS)

I know Jehovah’s with me, so why should I fear?
I know Jehovah’s with me, so why should I fear?
second:
2.

(CHORUS)
And like the breeze blowing out in the field, I feel peace right here.
I know Jehovah’s with me, so why should I fear?
I know Jehovah’s with me, so I will not fear.

first:

(CHORUS)
To whom could I go away?
Where could I turn in times of trouble?
To whom could I go away?
The voice of the stranger
Leads only to danger.

(CHORUS)

To whom could I go away?
The voice of the stranger

second:

There’ll be peace at last

From the valleys below
To the mountaintops,

To the ends of the earth,
There’ll be peace at last
For all eternity.

To the mountaintops,

To the ends of the earth,
There’ll be peace at last

To the mountaintops,
All creation will see

title: Together We Are Strong

We share just one faith, one God.

(PRE-CHORUS)

(CHORUS)
Together, united, together we belong.
Together, united, together we are strong.

(CHORUS)

Make time for Jehovah.
Make time.
Make time.
Make time.
Make time.
Make time.
Make time.
Make time.

2.

You can walk, but please don’t run.
It’s hard to do when you’re having fun.
But there’s a reason we don’t race;
When you’re with the friends,
It’s not the time or place.
(CHORUS)
Don’t run so fast.
Take your time, and make things last.
Learn to love the things you do.
Just don’t run fast.
second:

Learn to love the friends;
Let them know you care.
(CHORUS)
Don’t run so fast.
Take your time, and make things last.
Learn to love the things you do.
Just don’t run fast.

Is there someone home?
Well, you’re not real sure.
But look around and see ev’ryone,

Can you talk to one?
(CHORUS)
Don’t run so fast.
Take your time, and make things last.
Learn to love the things you do.
Just don’t run fast.
Oh. Just don’t run fast!

title: Blessings of Learning a Language
first:
1.
You may be contemplating,
‘Should I make the move?’
Prayerf’ly meditating,
‘Jehovah, what should I do?’
So let’s just take a moment
And try to help you decide.
’Cause if you step on over,
You’ll be so happy you tried!
(CHORUS)
You gotta step on over
And leave your worries behind.
’Cause when you step on over,
You will be blessed if you try, oh.
Step on over.
Step on over that Macedonia line!

You’ll be appreciating
How strangers give you their best.
And you will draw even closer

(CHORUS)
You gotta step on over
And leave your worries behind.
’Cause when you step on over,
Oh, the treasures you’ll find.
Maybe you’re thinking it over
And wond’ring if it’s right, oh.
(CHORUS)
You gotta step on over.
You will be blessed if you try, oh.
Step on over.
Step on over.
You gotta step on over that Macedonia line!

title: Keep the Pace
first:
1.
The scene of this world is changing;
I can’t live in the past.
Please help me to keep running
Because we’re moving fast.
When we face opposition
And all the doors are closed,
Let’s follow new direction, then,
And find the well-disposed.
(CHORUS)
Let’s keep the pace.
You can take my hand.
Let’s win the race.
Don’t let go till the end.
Give what it takes,
And all you need is to keep the pace.
Keep the pace.
second:
2.
I have such good intentions
At the start of each new day,
But something always happens
That gets in the way.
When there is a challenge,
Things seem out of control.
But we have gifts to help us manage,
To keep us on the road.
(CHORUS)
Let’s keep the pace.
You can take my hand.
Let’s win the race.
Don’t let go till the end.
Give what it takes,
And all you need is to keep the pace.
Keep the pace.
third:
(BRIDGE)
Efforts are seen; blessings flow
When we go the extra mile.
Adjust to change; you will know
That you make your Father smile.
We live our hope;
It is clear.
You see it in our eyes​—
Paradise with no more tears.
I’m so glad that I tried
(CHORUS)
To keep the pace.
You can take my hand.
Let’s win the race.
Don’t let go till the end.
Give what it takes,
And all you need is to keep the pace.
Keep the pace.
Let’s keep the pace.
You can take my hand.
Let’s win the race.
Don’t let go till the end.
Give what it takes,
And all you need is to keep the pace.
Keep the pace.

title: Imagine the Time
first:
1.
Life is hard, and it wears us down.
There’s not enough to go around.
I close my eyes, and there I see
That ev’ry hope has come to be.
(CHORUS)
Imagine the time when there’s no more pain,
When life’s so good and we are young again.
Imagine the time when we wake up and say,
“Thank you, thank you for this new life and this brand new day!”
second:
2.
Not a sound has ever touched my ears,
And eyes grow dim with passing years.
But ears will hear when music plays.
And eyes will see each brand new day.
(CHORUS)
Imagine the time when there’s no more pain,
When life’s so good and we are young again.
Imagine the time when we wake up and say,
“Thank you, thank you for this new life and this brand new day!”
third:
(BRIDGE)
I might not be the way I want to be.
But one day soon, I’ll be running free!
(CHORUS)
Imagine the time when there’s no more pain,
When life’s so good and we are young again.
Imagine the time when we’re dancing out the door!
Ev’ry day is better than before.
(CHORUS)
Imagine the time when there’s no more pain,
When life’s so good and we are young again.
Imagine the time when we wake up and say,
“Thank you, thank you for this brand new day!”

title: Take Your Time, Choose Wisely
first:
1.
Ev’rything’s fine, but I’m wondering,
‘Who will I marry?’
What I’m doing right now is deciding not to hurry.
This is a choice that could either bring laughter or sorrow.
And the feelings that start in a youthful heart, they could be gone tomorrow.
(CHORUS)
Take your time; patience is the key.
Just wait and see.
Use your head, though your heart may not agree,
And think, ‘Is this the one for me?’
Possibly, if you just take your time.
And choose wisely.
second:
2.
Well, I wanted someone who would care for me, and he made me feel special.
But I knew in my heart this could never be successful.
I want to make sure it’s Jehovah’s way.
Let his Word guide me.
And I’m willing to wait just to have a mate living the truth beside me.
(CHORUS)
Take your time; patience is the key.
Just wait and see.
Use your head, though your heart may not agree,
And think, ‘Is this the one for me?’
Possibly, if you just take your time.
And choose wisely.
And choose wisely.

title: I Give You My Best
first:
1.
You gave us a trust,
A son to cherish and to train.
Those years are past
And gone so fast.
Now we rejoice
To see his choice,
To know our work was not in vain.
(CHORUS)
It’s hard letting go;
Yet in my heart I know
The safest place that he can be
Is in your loving hands for now
And all eternity.
In all the years to come,
I know my heart will be at rest.
I give to you what you deserve;
I give to you my very best.
second:
2.
You gave us a girl,
A gift to nurture and to love.
Through all the years,
Through joy and tears,
Our precious one
Has now become
The woman we are so proud of.
(CHORUS)
It’s hard letting go;
Yet in my heart I know
The safest place that she can be
Is in your loving hands for now
And all eternity.
In all the years to come,
I know my heart will be at rest.
I give to you what you deserve;
I give to you my very best.

The world in chaos, but here we got peace.
And we’re just starting; we’re just starting.
(CHORUS)
We are sisters, we are brothers, sons and daughters, and more.
And I love you even though I never met you before.
We are sisters, we are brothers, sons and daughters, and more.

I feel refreshed like a newborn baby.

(CHORUS)
We are sisters, we are brothers, sons and daughters, and more.

We are sisters, we are brothers, sons and daughters, and more.

title: Jehovah Welcomes You Home
first:
1.
It doesn’t seem so long ago
When my name you’d come to know,
And it touched your heart.
But you lost your way.
Although you managed for a while
And some mem’ries made you smile,
It was in your heart to return one day.
(CHORUS)
Welcome home, my friend.
Your life can start again.
Stay beneath my wings
And know the lasting peace
Only I can bring.
second:
2.
And I desire that you should know
What to do to come back home​—
As a ray of sun on a weary heart.
Now here I stand with open arms;
I’m your shelter from the storm.
You can feel the joy
Of a brand new start.
(CHORUS)
Welcome home, my friend.
Your life can start again.
Stay beneath my wings
And know the lasting peace
Only I can bring.
Now you’re home.

title: Finding Treasures
first:
1.
In my reading and my study,
There are treasures that I find
When I’m searching, digging deeper,
When I take a little time.
In my imagination, I am in the scene.
It helps me understand just what the Bible means.
(CHORUS)
Imagination and meditation​—
These are the things that help me see.
They give the insight to help me do right
And be the person I should be​—
The person I should be.
second:
2.
I can ponder on the people​—
Some were faithful; some were not.
Their example gives me insight
To God’s feelings and his thought.
Sometimes my meditation makes me realize
How I can be more pleasing in Jehovah’s eyes.
(CHORUS)
Imagination and meditation​—

They give the insight to help us do right

title: Just a Smile
first:
1.
We can tell a hundred stories;
We can speak a million words;
We can paint a thousand pictures,
But will a heart be stirred?
We can often make a diff’rence
With a kindly word or deed,
But sometimes just a smile
Is all we really need.
(CHORUS)
Just a smile can lift a weary heart.
Just a smile can help us make a start.
When you’ve done your best praying you’ll succeed,
Then you will see a smile is what we need.
second:
2.
This world is unforgiving—full of coldness and despair.
Many hopes are disappointed by a world that doesn’t care.
And we see it in their faces as they pass us on the street.
So we offer hope and comfort to the people that we meet.
(CHORUS)
Just a smile can lift a weary heart.
Just a smile can help us make a start.
When you’ve done your best praying you’ll succeed,
Then you will see a smile is what we need.
third:
3.

For some hearts are just too hardened to receive the Kingdom seed.

(CHORUS)
Just a smile can lift a weary heart.
Just a smile can help us make a start.
When you’ve done your best praying you’ll succeed,
Then you will see a smile is what we need.

title: Now Is the Time
first:
1.

We will seize this opportunity
To declare Jehovah’s name,
And the blessings of his Kingdom
Is the message we’ll proclaim.
(CHORUS)
Now is the time
For preaching with zeal.
We’ll never give up or give way to fear.
And now is the time
To show how we feel,
Now that the final days are here.
second:
2.
There will never be another time
For this preaching to be done.
So we want to have a part in it
And reach out to ev’ryone.
When we look back in some future time
At these days in which we live,
Then we’ll say that for Jehovah
We gave all that we could give.
(CHORUS)
Now is the time
For preaching with zeal.
We’ll never give up or give way to fear.
And now is the time
To show how we feel,
Now that the final days are here.

title: Glad I Passed the Test
first:
1.
Seems like there’s something ev’ry day,
Some new test that comes my way—something ev’ry day.
I never know what it might be.
But whatever it might be, I know I have the key
’Cause I can face it if I’m steady,
And prepare so I’ll be ready​—
How to act and what to say
When a challenge comes my way.
At times it’s tough for me out there,
And so I turn to God in prayer.
(CHORUS)
I pray I’ll pass each test—
Ev’ry one that comes my way.
I pray I’ll pass each test,
And be faithful through the day.
second:
2.
Some things I know I’ll face again,
Like the pressure to fit in—face it once again.
There will be times when other kids
Do the things that God forbids—the things that God forbids​—
And pressure me to go along with
Kids I know I don’t belong with.
That’s the time I call to mind
I don’t want to be that kind
’Cause I’m a Witness for God’s name,
So there’s no cause to be ashamed.
(CHORUS)
I’m glad I passed the test.
I was faithful all day long.
I’m glad I passed the test.
I’m glad that I was strong.

title: Give You My All
second:

I know you’re real; it’s plain to see.
No other God could there be for me.
Life’s not a party, not just for fun;
The journey’s just begun.
I want to give you my best while I’m still young,
To side with you and your Son.
(CHORUS)
I want to stand up on my two feet;
I want to answer the call.
I want to have your help when I am weak;
I want to give you my all.
I want to give you my all.
I want to give you my all.
I want to give you my all.

title: “Honor Jehovah With Your Valuable Things”
first:
1.
There’s nothing Jehovah could possibly need.
He made ev’rything from the start.
So, what can I give him, or how can I live
In a way that brings joy to his heart?
Now I know what it takes, so with each day that breaks
Here’s what I will do:
(CHORUS)
I’ll give to you, Jehovah, the best I have to give.
I’ll live for you, Jehovah, as long as I may live.
No matter what life brings,
I’ll honor you with my valu’ble things.
second:
2.
With love in your heart you have given us life,
And I treasure the joy that it brings.
What more can I do to give honor to you,
Than to give you my valu’ble things?
Yes I know what it takes, so with each day that breaks
I know what I will do:
(CHORUS)
I’ll give to you, Jehovah, the best I have to give.
I’ll live for you, Jehovah, as long as I may live.
No matter what life brings,
I’ll honor you with my valu’ble things.

title: Never Give Up
first:
1.
Father, for me, the time has now come—
Fulfilling the words that were said by your Son:
‘If they persecuted me, then they’ll do it to you.’
It’s not a surprise, really, nothing that’s new.
Jehovah, I pray, please let me be strong.
My life and devotion—to you they belong.
My record of faith will never be lost.
I’ll be loyal to you no matter the cost.
I’ll never give in to taunts or to threats.
Enduring in faith, I’ll have no regrets.
To suffer these things for the sake of your name,
I count as an honor; I won’t be ashamed.
(CHORUS)
I won’t give up, won’t turn aside.
I won’t give up, and I won’t run and hide.
Let me be strong; let me be true,
Carrying on, trusting in you.
I won’t give up.
second:
2.
You’ve trusted in me. I’ve trusted in you.
Each trial I face, you help me get through.
No king and no ruler, no fam’ly or friend
Can make me lose sight of the prize at the end.
(CHORUS)
I won’t give up, won’t turn aside.
I won’t give up, and I won’t run and hide.
Let me be strong; let me be true,
Carrying on, trusting in you.
I won’t give up, won’t turn aside.
I won’t give up, and I won’t run and hide.
Let me be strong; let me be true,
Carrying on, trusting in you.
I won’t give up.

title: What Means the Most to Me
first:
1.
What are the things that I value,
The things that mean the most to me?
What are the things that will help me to be—⁠
To be the person I want to be?
With each new day there are choices to be made.
Sometimes the choice will need to be a trade.
The time I have can never be replaced.
The steps I take can never be retraced.
That’s why I want to choose carefully
And choose what really means the most to me.
How will I honor Jehovah,
The one who means the most to me?
I’ll give the best I can offer to him.
And he deserves the best I can be.

title: If You Could See What I See
first:
1.
I’m just a cart made up of bits and pieces—
A frame, a handle, and some wheels.
But I’m a cart that helps to give a witness.
What is that like?
Let me tell you how it feels.
(CHORUS)
If you could see what I see,
If you could visit all the places that I go,
If you could see the people there
And get a glimpse of all the faces that I get to know,
(CHORUS)
If you could hear what I hear
When they see things they’ve never had a chance to see,
That’s when you’ll see how it can be
That forever they’ll remember me.
second:
(BRIDGE)
I’ve got wheels; I’ve got racks;
I’ve got books, and I’ve got tracts.
I take the Kingdom message ev’rywhere.
When the crowds pass me by,
I’m designed to catch their eye.
Wherever people gather, count on me ’cause I’ll be there.
(CHORUS)
If you could do what I do,
You’d know the happiness that always fills my heart.
What a feeling to go wheeling!
I’m so glad to be a public-witness cart.

title: We Won’t Forget You
first:
1.
When the wind blows,
When the rain comes,
When the ground beneath you starts to slip away,
God is always near.
And he cares for you.
You’re not alone.
Your friends are here.
We’ll help you find your way.
(CHORUS)
We won’t forget you.
We are your family.
We won’t ignore you.
We will not fail to see.
We’ll take your hand.
We’ll help you stand.
We’ll help you carry on.
We won’t forget you.
We are your family.

When the day breaks,
When our love surrounds you like a warm embrace,

A perfect bond,

(CHORUS)
We won’t forget you.
We are your family.
We won’t ignore you.
We will not fail to see.
We’ll take your hand.
We’ll help you stand.
We’ll help you carry on.
We won’t forget you.
We are a worldwide family.

We are your family.

Look what I’ve found.
(CHORUS)

That is the best feeling ever.
I know this’ll last forever. I’m where I want to be.
This is the best life ever.
